==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|ま|な|yomi=k}}

===Etymology===
Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=まな|真|tr1=ma|t1=true|魚|tr2=na|t2=fish; side dish}}, from the way that edible fish was often used as the main side dish at meals.  The ''na'' element was variously spelled {{m|ja|菜|lit=vegetables}}, {{m|ja|魚|lit=fish}}, and {{m|ja|肴|lit=side dish}} depending on context.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|まな|acc=1|acc_ref=SMK5}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|まな}}

# {{l|en|fish}} used for eating

* {{ja-r|真%魚%箸|ま%な%ばし}}: {{l|en|cooking}} {{l|en|chopsticks}}
* {{ja-r|真%魚 始|ま%な はじめ}}: a {{l|en|ceremony}} to mark a {{l|en|child}}'s transition to eating {{l|en|solid}} {{l|en|food}}
